title: The Unseen Shield of Mallory Wood
summary: Mallory Wood, a 45-year-old consultant and lecturer, discovers her ability to become invisible and uses it to protect her community over a course of a week.
summaryGerman: Mallory Wood, eine 45-jährige Beraterin und Dozentin, entdeckt ihre Fähigkeit, unsichtbar zu werden und nutzt sie, um ihre Gemeinde im Laufe einer Woche zu schützen.
summaryDutch: Mallory Wood, een 45-jarige consultant en docente, ontdekt haar vermogen om onzichtbaar te worden en gebruikt dit om haar gemeenschap gedurende een week te beschermen.
summaryFrench: Mallory Wood, consultante et conférencière de 45 ans, découvre sa capacité à devenir invisible et l'utilise pour protéger sa communauté au cours d'une semaine.

story.text: Mallory Wood accidentally becomes invisible while experimenting with a new lecture technique involving quantum physics and personal barriers. Feeling confused yet intrigued, she decides to explore her new ability.
Still adjusting to her powers, Mallory uses her invisibility to overhear a dubious plan at the local corporation. She anonymously tips off the authorities, preventing a major data breach.
Encouraged by her success, Mallory speaks at a community center about personal safety and secretly foils a pickpocket operation in the crowd.
Feeling the weight of her secret, Mallory contemplates the ethical implications of her power during a lonely morning jog. She resolves to use her power only for good.
Mallory becomes the invisible hero at a local bank, stopping a robbery by leading the police to the suspects without revealing her presence.
Taking a day off, Mallory spends time with her family, who are unaware of her abilities. She feels peaceful yet distant, contemplating the dual life she now leads.
Mallory inspires her seminar attendees with a talk on unseen heroes in society, hinting at her own acts while maintaining her anonymity.

ending: Mallory Wood's journey as the silent guardian of her community continued, her unseen presence a constant shield against unseen threats.
moral: Great power requires not only responsibility but also discretion.
